channel.title: Business News
channel.description: Latest headlines for business news around the world.

item.title: Xi is expected to invite Biden to the Beijing Winter Olympics, sources say
item.description: As the U.S. and China continue discussions on a virtual summit to be held between Xi and Biden, the 2022 Beijing Winter Olympics loom large.

item.title: Embark CEO sees supply chain crisis as the 'inflection point' for autonomous trucking
item.description: The congestion at U.S. ports, the trucker shortage and the rise of e-commerce have created a unique opportunity, Embark Trucks CEO Alex Rodrigues told CNBC.

item.title: Southeast Asia's Zalora expects record-breaking Singles Day sales
item.description: E-commerce company Zalora is anticipating record-breaking business this Singles Day amid economic reopening and increased tech adoption across the region.

item.title: Governments and Big Oil were first. The next wave of climate lawsuits will target banks and boards
item.description: Financial institutions and individual board members could be the next targets of climate litigation cases.

item.title: Jim Cramer says these 4 companies are the best ways to invest in the metaverse
item.description: "Will younger people want a piece of this? I can't be sure ... but I know money managers love it and maybe that's more important," CNBC's Jim Cramer said.

item.title: Cramer's lightning round: Rivian will go even higher
item.description: "Mad Money" host Jim Cramer rings the lightning round bell, which means he's giving his answers to callers' stock questions at rapid speed.

item.title: Mastercard CEO bullish on travel trends as borders open: 'Tourists are arriving, and they're spending'
item.description: "The power of travel is coming back. It's coming back to our P&L. ... The trends are super encouraging," Mastercard CEO Michael Miebach told CNBC.

item.title: Jim Cramer attempts to make sense of EV start-up Rivian's $86 billion valuation
item.description: "Rivian's stock price is set by buyers who believe that electric vehicles are taking over the world," the "Mad Money" host said.

item.title: Foxconn buys Lordstown Motors' old GM factory for $230 million
item.description: Shares of Lordstown rose more than 12% after hours on the news.

item.title: Ford's stake in EV truck start-up Rivian is worth more than $10 billion in first day of trading
item.description: Based on Rivian's closing price of $100.73 a share Wednesday, Ford's roughly 102 million shares of the company are worth about $10.3 billion.

item.title: Rivian customers who pre-ordered electric SUVs and trucks made millions from IPO pop
item.description: As part of Rivian's IPO, the electric vehicle company reserved shares for people who have pre-ordered a truck or SUV as of Sept. 30.

item.title: SpaceX launches the Crew-3 mission for NASA, the company's fifth human spaceflight
item.description: Elon Musk's SpaceX launched four astronauts from Florida on Wednesday.

item.title: Beyond Meat shares crater as losses mount, company expects weak U.S. sales growth ahead
item.description: Beyond Meat reported a wider-than-expected loss for its fourth quarter and revenue that fell short of analysts' estimates.

item.title: AMC CEO Adam Aron sold $25 million in shares Tuesday, after warning meme investors he would do so
item.description: AMC CEO Adam Aron has filed paperwork with the SEC that would permit him to sell 1.25 million shares of the company worth about $48 million at current prices.

item.title: 'There will be billionaires made.' Why one NBA player is all in on cryptocurrency
item.description: "This asset class isn't going anywhere," NBA player Spencer Dinwiddie said of cryptocurrency. "There will be billionaires made."

item.title: Retail and trucking trade groups sue Biden administration to overturn vaccine mandate
item.description: An appellate court had temporarily halted the vaccine and testing requirement, saying there are "grave statutory and constitutional issues with the Mandate."

item.title: SpaceX is about to launch four more astronauts for NASA. Here's what you should know
item.description: Elon Musk's space company is set to launch the Crew-3 mission for NASA on Wednesday evening, in the fifth SpaceX crewed mission in the past 18 months.

item.title: Royal Caribbean CEO sees historically strong summer bookings, plans to pay down Covid debt
item.description: "That will generate the cash flow that we need to pay down the debt" and reinvest, Royal Caribbean outgoing CEO Richard Fain told CNBC on Wednesday.

item.title: Rivian IPO proves General Motors is undervalued, says GM CEO Mary Barra
item.description: Rivian's stock is indicated to open at $125 a share, a 60% pop from its IPO price of $78 a share and implying a valuation of as much as $106.6 billion.

item.title: White House says about 900,000 kids ages 5 to 11 got a Covid vaccine in the first week after its approval
item.description: About 900,000 kids ages 5 to 11 have received their first dose of a Covid vaccine since the CDC cleared the shots Nov. 2, the White House said Wednesday.

item.title: After weeks of declines, U.S. Covid cases have stalled at a high level: 'The ERs are packed'
item.description: The downward trajectory in Covid cases in the U.S. has plateaued in recent weeks, bouncing between 70,000 and 75,000 new cases a day for nearly three weeks

item.title: Shift4 stock surges after company signs payments deal with SpaceX's Starlink
item.description: Shares of payments processing company Shift4 surged after the company announced a five-year partnership with SpaceX's Starlink satellite internet service.

item.title: Meta and Microsoft announce partnership to integrate Workplace and Teams
item.description: Meta, the company formerly known as Facebook, announced a partnership that will allow customers to integrate Workplace with Microsoft Teams.

item.title: McDonald's teams up with Mariah Carey for holiday promotion in latest celebrity collaboration
item.description: McDonald's is aiming to juice its holiday sales through a collaboration with pop star Mariah Carey.

item.title: EV start-up Rivian is valued at $86 billion after market debut, higher than Ford
item.description: Rivian, which is backed by Amazon and Ford, has attracted intense interest from investors looking to capitalize on the fast-growing EV market.

item.title: Only 28% of New York office workers are back in the office
item.description: A new survey suggests that remote work will endure long after January and reduce the demand for office space in New York.

item.title: Op-ed: The future of socially responsible investing is in female hands
item.description: As sustainable investing continues to grow, women are taking the lead as investors, industry decision-makers and corporate executives.

item.title: 5 things to know before the stock market opens Wednesday
item.description: U.S. stock futures fell Wednesday after this week's second major inflation report showed consumer prices soaring last month.

item.title: Southwest and British Airways fuel deals send Velocys shares surging by over 40%
item.description: The agreements relate to a planned biorefinery in Mississippi.

item.title: American Airlines pilots union rejects holiday bonus pay, seeks permanent changes
item.description: American Airlines pilots union turned down a company offer to pay 50% more for holiday trips.
